text:
The leadership trio of Italian unification included:
  • {{c1::Cavour}}, {{c4::who handled diplomacy}}
  • {{c2::Garibaldi}}, {{c5::who led volunteer military campaigns}}
  • {{c3::Mazzini}}, {{c6::who promoted nationalist ideology}}

{{c1::Simón Bolívar}} played a central role in the independence of:
  • {{c2::Bolivia}}
  • {{c3::Colombia}}
  • {{c4::Ecuador}}
  • {{c5::Peru}}
  • {{c6::Venezuela}}
notes: Known as “El Libertador,” Bolívar envisioned a large unified Latin American state, though regional divisions prevented it.
